page.title: 02FARMING
page.content: Buckleaze Farm is situated near the River Avon and has a lot of wet land. The animals are dairy cattle, beef cows, horses and peacocks. There are two horses, 4 beef heifers, 12 steers and 57 milking cows. The farm has no bull and so uses artificial insemination for breeding. The 150 acres is split up: 13 acres of kale, 8 acres of wheat,25 acres of potatoes, seven acres of hay and the other 97 acres is grassland or marsh. The wheat is specially grown for thatching straw. It will be cut with a binder, stooked and then thrashed. The potatoes are for the chipping business and the farm has ponds of crayfish which will be sold to restaurants.
